alert.note: Alert for Charles City; James City; Prince George; Surry; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 7:51PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Charles City, Prince George, northeastern Sussex, southwestern James City and Surry Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 751 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Burrowsville to near Disputanta. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Williamsburg, Charles City, Waverly, Claremont, Surry, Disputanta, Dendron, Rustic, Burrowsville, Garysville, Elberon, Cabin Point, Taylors Corner, Carsley, Spring Grove, Ewell, Gwaltney Corner, Oak Hill Corner, New Hope and Savedge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for south central, southeastern and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; James City; Prince George; Surry; Sussex
